verses.text: 吃書卷他對我說：「人子啊，把你得到的吃下去吧！吃下這書卷，然後去向以色列家說話。」

words.note: A messianic title used by Jesus for himself.
Refers to ancient manuscripts rolled into scrolls.

verses.text: 於是我把口張開，他就給我吃下那書卷。
他又對我說：「人子啊！把我賜給你的那書卷吃下去，填滿你的肚子。」於是我吃了，這書卷在我口裡像蜜糖一樣甘甜。

words.note: Indicates completed action or change of state.
Used with 像 (xiàng) to mean 'like...as'.

verses.text: 受主訓勉他對我說：「人子啊，你去！到以色列家那裡，把我的話告訴他們。
你受差派不是到一個說話難明、言語難懂的民族那裡去，而是到以色列家去；
不是到說話難明、言語難懂的眾多民族那裡去，他們的話是你聽不懂的。但是，如果我差派你到他們那裡去，他們必聽從你。

words.note: Verb-complement construction: listen + not + understand.
Often indicates a strong future certainty or necessity.
Often implies obedience to authority or divine command.

verses.text: 以色列家卻不肯聽從你，因為他們不肯聽從我，整個以色列家都是額堅心硬的。

words.note: Refers to the people of Israel as a collective entity.
Often implies obedience to authority or divine command.
Often implies obedience to authority or divine command.
Refers to the people of Israel as a collective entity.
Biblical idiom describing stubbornness and disobedience, lit. 'forehead firm, heart hard'.

verses.text: 看哪！我要使你的臉像他們的臉一樣堅硬，使你的前額像他們的前額一樣堅硬。

words.note: Often used in scripture to draw attention to a divine declaration.

verses.text: 我要使你的額好像最堅硬的寶石，比火石更硬。他們雖然是叛逆的民族，你卻不要怕他們，在他們面前，也不要驚惶。」

words.note: Refers to a hard, common stone, often used metaphorically for hardness in the Bible.
Used in both secular and religious contexts for defying authority.
Frequently used in biblical contexts meaning to be terrified or dismayed, often by divine command not to be.

verses.text: 他又對我說：「人子啊！我對你說的一切話，你都要留心聽，記在心裡。

words.note: A messianic title used frequently in the Bible, especially by Jesus.
An idiomatic phrase meaning to remember something deeply.

verses.text: 你去，到被擄的人民那裡，向他們宣講；他們或聽或不聽，你只要對他們說：『主耶和華這樣說。』」

words.note: Lit. 'that which is captured/exiled'.
Transliteration of Hebrew YHWH, God's personal name.

verses.text: 那時，靈使我升起，我就聽見後面有轟轟的響聲：「耶和華的居所顯現出來的榮耀是應當稱頌的！」

words.note: Often refers to God's Spirit in biblical contexts.
見 acts as a resultative complement, meaning 'to successfully hear'.
轟轟 is an onomatopoeia for a loud rumbling sound.
Describes something that has appeared or been made visible.
Used in '是...的' construction to emphasize or nominalize.

verses.text: 我又聽見那些活物的翅膀彼此相碰的聲音和活物旁邊的輪子的聲音，以及轟轟的響聲。

words.note: 見 acts as a resultative complement, meaning 'to successfully hear'.
Often refers to celestial beings like cherubim/seraphim.
轟轟 is an onomatopoeia for a loud rumbling sound.

verses.text: 靈使我升起，把我提去。那時我心靈忿激、愁苦。耶和華的手強而有力臨到我身上。

words.note: Often refers to God's Spirit in biblical contexts.
Used to bring the object before the verb.
An idiom meaning 'strong and powerful'.
Often used to refer to 'upon me/him/etc.'

verses.text: 於是我來到提勒．亞畢被擄的人那裡，他們住在迦巴魯河邊。我在他們居住的地方坐了七天，在他們中間震驚得不知所措。

words.note: Lit. 'that which is captured/exiled'.
迦巴魯 is the name, 河 means 'river'.
Indicates result or degree following a verb or adjective.
An idiom meaning 'not know how to handle/respond'.

verses.text: 作以色列家的守望者過了七天，耶和華的話臨到我說：
「人子啊，我立了你作以色列家守望的人，所以你要聆聽我口中的話，替我警告他們。

words.note: More formal than just '聽'.

verses.text: 如果我對惡人說：『你必定死亡！』你卻不警告他，也不警戒他離開惡行，好救他的性命，這惡人就必因自己的罪孽死亡。但我要因他的死追究你。

words.definition: so as to, in order to

verses.text: 如果你警告惡人，他仍不離開他的罪惡和他的惡行，他就必因自己的罪孽死亡，你卻救了自己的性命。
如果義人偏離正義，行事邪惡，我必把絆腳石放在他面前，他必定死亡；因為你沒有警告他，他必因自己的罪死亡。他素常所行的義，也必不被記念。但我要因他的死追究你。

words.note: Introduces the object before the verb.

verses.text: 如果你警告義人不要犯罪，他就不犯罪。他因為接受警告，就必存活，你也救了自己的性命。」
暫時緘口不言耶和華的手在那裡臨到我身上，他對我說：「你起來，出到平原去，在那裡我要向你說話。」

words.note: An idiom meaning 'to keep one's mouth shut'.

verses.text: 於是，我起來，出到平原去，看見耶和華的榮耀停在那裡，這榮耀就像我在迦巴魯河邊看見的一樣。於是我俯伏在地。
靈進到我裡面，使我站立起來，耶和華對我說：「你進去，把自己關在家裡。

words.note: Refers to a divine spirit, or the Spirit of God.

verses.text: 人子啊！人要用繩子把你捆綁起來，使你不能出到他們中間去。

words.note: A messianic title often used in the Old and New Testaments.

verses.text: 我要使你的舌頭貼住上膛，使你變成啞巴，不能作責備他們的人，因為他們是叛逆的民族。

words.note: Refers to the upper part of the mouth.
Connects verb phrase to noun, forming 'one who rebukes them'.

verses.text: 但我對你說話的時候，我必開你的口，你就要對他們說：『主耶和華這樣說。』肯聽的就讓他聽，不肯聽的，就由他不聽吧，因為他們是叛逆的民族。」

words.note: Links clause to 時候 (time).
Implies a definite and often divinely ordained action.
Title for God or a deity.
Transliteration of God's personal name.
Turns 'willing to listen' into 'those who are willing to listen'.
Turns 'unwilling to listen' into 'those who are unwilling to listen'.
